User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user profile in the Nexus dating app.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the user.

interestedIn.description: Gender(s) the user is interested in.

location.description: The user's current location (e.g., city, state).

latitude.description: The latitude of the user's location.

longitude.description: The longitude of the user's location.

lastSeen.description: The last time the user was active.

avatarUrl.description: URL of the user's primary profile picture.

imageUrls.description: An array of URLs for the user's gallery images.

videoUrl.description: URL of the user's introductory video.

voiceNoteUrl.description: URL of the user's voice note.

globalMode.description: Whether the user wants to see profiles from all over the world, sorted by distance.

maxDistance.description: The maximum distance in kilometers for discovery.

ageRange.description: The preferred age range for discovery.

Match.title: Match
Match.description: Represents a match or potential chat between two users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Match entity.

users.description: Array containing the UIDs of both matched users.

lastMessage.description: The last message sent in the chat.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the last message sent.

Swipe.title: Swipe
Swipe.description: Represents a swipe action (like, nope, superlike) from one user to another.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a chat message between two users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Message entity.

senderId.description: Reference to User who sent the message. (Relationship: User 1:N Message)

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the message was last updated.

isEdited.description: Indicates if the message has been edited.

isAiGenerated.description: Indicates whether the message was generated by AI.

reactions.description: A map of emoji reactions to an array of user IDs.

Prompt.title: Prompt
Prompt.description: Represents a prompt question for users to answer on their profile.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Prompt entity.

question.description: The text of the prompt question.

PromptAnswer.title: PromptAnswer
PromptAnswer.description: Represents a user's answer to a specific prompt.

id.description: Unique identifier for the PromptAnswer entity.

answer.description: The user's answer to the prompt.

likes.description: Number of likes the prompt answer has received.

CompatibilityRadarChart.title: CompatibilityRadarChart
CompatibilityRadarChart.description: Represents the data for a compatibility radar chart comparing two users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the CompatibilityRadarChart entity.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user.

params.name: userId
params.description: The UID of the user performing the swipe.

params.name: targetUserId
params.description: The UID of the user being swiped on.

definition.description: Stores who has liked the current user. Used for the 'Likes You' screen.

params.name: userId
params.description: The UID of the user who is being liked.

params.name: likerId
params.description: The UID of the user who performed the like.

params.name: matchId

params.name: compatibilityRadarChartId
params.description: The unique identifier of the compatibility radar chart.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure is designed to support the Nexus dating app's core features while adhering to the principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, DBAC (Database-Based Access Control), and QAPs (Rules are not Filters). It prioritizes security, scalability, and debuggability.

**Authorization Independence via Denormalization:**
*   User profiles are stored under `/users/{userId}`. Data needing authorization context from the user profile is denormalized to avoid `get()` calls in security rules. For example, prompt answers created by a user are stored in a subcollection `/users/{userId}/promptAnswers/{promptAnswerId}`. The prompt answer documents do not require any authorization data copied because access is solely based on path and `request.auth.uid`.
*   Matches between users are stored in a top-level `/matches/{matchId}` collection, which contains an array of `users`. Messages sent within a match are stored in a subcollection `/matches/{matchId}/messages/{messageId}`.  The message documents do not require any authorization data copied because access is solely based on path and `request.auth.uid`.

**Structural Segregation (Homogeneous Security Posture):**
*   Private user data (profiles, prompt answers, matches, and messages) is kept separate from potentially public data. This separation ensures that each collection has a clear and consistent security posture, avoiding the need for complex logic within security rules.

**Access Modeling (Standardization and Consistency):**
*   **Private Data:** User profiles and their associated data (prompt answers, swipes) utilize the path-based ownership pattern `/users/{userId}/*`. This approach allows straightforward security rules based on `request.auth.uid == userId`.
*   **Collaborative Data:** Matches and messages are secured using the `users` array in the parent match document.
